This #EqualPayDay we‚Äôre facing a global crisis that is disproportionately impacting women. Women lose an average of $10,000+ to the wage gap each year, and the disparity is even worse for women of color.
 
Now more than ever, we depend on our workers. ALL must receive #EqualPay.

The average woman in 2019 made just 81% of what her male counterpart earned.
 
Black women earned 67%.
Hispanic women earned 58%.
 
The #wagegap cannot be explained away. It persists across industry and occupation, regardless of experience or education.

RT @HouseForeign: Chairman @RepEliotEngel & Members statement on the 10th anniversary of the Haiti Earthquake:
Our hearts continue to go ou‚Ä¶

The country has experienced almost constant instability in the past 18 months, leading to dysfunction and suffering at new levels. I will continue to stand with the Haitian people and urge those involved to find a clear path forward for a democratic, functioning government.

I am proud of U.S. investments over the last decade to help the Haitian people rebuild and recover.
¬†
But Haiti‚Äôs consistent political and economic turmoil has made any significant improvement near impossible.
Today, we mark 10 years since Haiti was struck by a devastating earthquake, leading to one of the worst natural disasters in modern history and claiming 200,000 innocent Haitian lives.

Nine years ago today, my friend, former Rep. Gabby Giffords, was shot at an event in her district in Arizona. Six people died and 12 others were injured. Out of tragedy, she has created change and inspired others to do the same. https://t.co/3NxneL9gV6
I‚Äôm closely watching the situation in Iraq and praying for the service members, diplomats, and their families.
My heart is with those affected by this weekend‚Äôs incidents, and I will continue working to combat senseless hate.

The vandalism in Yorktown is yet another example of hate that has no place in our community. These acts, especially during this difficult time of anti-Semitic violence, further heighten fear among our friends and neighbors.

The assassination of Soleimani is an escalation that could quickly spiral out of control in an already violent region. The White House needs to quickly mobilize to protect lives & assets & to prevent us from being drawn into yet another Middle East war.

Without a known, comprehensive strategy regarding Iran, such unilateral military action without Congressional notification or consultation raises serious concerns ‚Äì the Administration must immediately brief Congress on their plan going forward.

It is undeniable that Soleimani was responsible for taking countless lives, as well as for instability & violence around the globe. I will not mourn his death. With that said, I am deeply troubled by the steps leading up to the strike, & the repercussions of these actions.
